citation.article-title: Nitriliruptor alkaliphilus gen. nov., sp. nov., a deep-lineage haloalkaliphilic actinobacterium from soda lakes capable of growth on aliphatic nitriles, and proposal of Nitriliruptoraceae fam. nov. and Nitriliruptorales ord. nov.
citation.source: International Journal of Systematic and Evolutionary Microbiology

p.s: Nitriliruptor (Ni.tri.li.rupâ€²tor. N.L. n. nitrilum nitrile, nitrile group; L. masc. n. ruptor breaker; N.L. masc. n. nitriliruptor nitrile-breaker).
The dominant fatty acids in the polar lipids are saturated C14-C16 components.
Aerobic, and utilize short-chain organic acids, amides and aliphatic nitriles as energy and carbon source.
A member of the class Actinobacteria.
The type species is Nitriliruptor alkaliphilus.
